availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Washington L Skinner (Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Married to Martha Skinner. Father of James M. Skinner, Washington C. Skinner, Josiah Skinner, Samuel E. Skinner, and Mattie Skinner. Farmer in Ballard County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Ballard County, Lovelaceville District, p. 161. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedule, Kentucky, Ballard County, Lovelaceville District, p. 21. Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Ballard County, Lovelaceville Magisterial District No. 2, p. 27.
Find A Grave, "Washington Lee Skinner (1819-1885)," Memorial #98661554, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=98661554&ref=acom (accessed September 21, 2017).
